Settings Documentation

Settings DocumentationÂ¶

This module contains all settings that define the servers behaviour. They can roughly be categorized into

  • Django settings

  • Plugin system settings

  • miscellaneous

For all django specific settings look at this and this.

The plugin and miscellaneous settings should be documented. Those that arenâ€™t are best left alone. For settings specific to individual plugins read up on the plugin tutorial.

Most settings are available via the generated config.ini. However not all of them (most of the time that is on purpose).

Every setting specified in the config.ini or in the settings.py itself can be overriden by setting an environment variable with the same name.

RIXAWebserver.settings.ALLOWED_HOSTSÂ¶

List of domains which the webserver serves. â€˜*â€™ means all connections will be accepted. Needs to be properly configured before deploying.

RIXAWebserver.settings.BASE_DIRÂ¶

The absolute path to the working directory (wd). If you want to change this via envvar use RIXA_WD.

RIXAWebserver.settings.BOOTSTRAP_THEMEÂ¶

Set actual css theme. Use BOOTSTRAP_THEME in config file for changing

RIXAWebserver.settings.CONSOLE_USE_COLORSÂ¶

Wether to print in colors to console. On some systems that isnâ€™t supported in which case you will get flooded with control sequences. Use this to deactivate colors in the console.

RIXAWebserver.settings.CSRF_COOKIE_SAMESITEÂ¶

Make site work without SSL

RIXAWebserver.settings.CSRF_COOKIE_SECUREÂ¶

Make site work without SSL

RIXAWebserver.settings.DATABASESÂ¶

https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/4.1/ref/settings/#databases

RIXAWebserver.settings.DEBUGÂ¶

SECURITY WARNING: donâ€™t run with debug turned on in production!

RIXAWebserver.settings.DISABLED_LOGGERSÂ¶

Loggers that will be excluded on all outputs

RIXAWebserver.settings.DISABLE_PLUGIN_MODULE_CHECKÂ¶

If activated the server will not check if a specified venv and plugin are compatible. Can be useful if you import via adding paths or use a more complicated setup for imports. Be aware that should you have missing imports and this activated the server will be in a unsafe state.

RIXAWebserver.settings.GENERATE_INTERMEDIARY_FILESÂ¶

Wether or not to dump all sorts of stuff into a new debug folder in the working dir. Only really useful for development on the plugin system itself.

RIXAWebserver.settings.IGNORE_PLUGIN_WARNINGSÂ¶

Disable this if you suspect faulty behaviour could be missing due to a missing warning. Will add some annoying mesages.

RIXAWebserver.settings.LANGUAGESÂ¶

Internationalization. I strongly recommend not changing any of this as it will break the entire site

RIXAWebserver.settings.LOG_FILE_TYPEÂ¶

Either none, html or txt. None means no log files are created. html supports color formatting while.

RIXAWebserver.settings.LOG_FMTÂ¶

Format to be used for logging. See https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logrecord-attributes There is an additional session_id attribute. Itâ€™s behaviour is defined by LOG_UID_MODE

RIXAWebserver.settings.LOG_UID_MODEÂ¶

Either none, session or username. None means attribute will stay empty. session means filling with session identifier. username with username.

RIXAWebserver.settings.MAINTENANCE_MODEÂ¶

prevents access to server outside of localhost. With asgi blocks all connections.

RIXAWebserver.settings.MAX_BLOCKING_CALLSÂ¶

Max number of concurrent sync awaitables. Corresponds to the maximum number of non local plugin calls the server handles in total.

RIXAWebserver.settings.MAX_LOAD_TIME_PER_MODULEÂ¶

Multiplied by 0.01s. You can change this to prevent a plugin timing out while loading a huge module. On the flipside it will take longer for the server to skip crashed plugins.

RIXAWebserver.settings.MAX_LOG_SIZEÂ¶

Max file size in kb before new logfile will be created. Normally there are 2 backup logfiles. 1 kb~6-9 log messages for txt and ~4-7 for html

RIXAWebserver.settings.MAX_PLUGIN_STACK_DEPTHÂ¶

Basically the maximum depth of nested function calls between plugins. Prevents circular deadlock.

RIXAWebserver.settings.MAX_USER_JOBSÂ¶

Max non async jobs that a connected user can commit

RIXAWebserver.settings.NLP_BACKENDÂ¶

Which NLP backend to use. If the specified backend has not been loaded it will reset to none. None means the chat only supports manual commands.

RIXAWebserver.settings.NLP_GREETINGÂ¶

Greeting message when user connects to server

RIXAWebserver.settings.PLUGIN_PATHSÂ¶

Where to search for plugins besides the current working directory

RIXAWebserver.settings.PYENV_LOCÂ¶

If set to an existing path with pyenv in it you allow the server to manage venvs on its own.

RIXAWebserver.settings.PYENV_PY_BASEÂ¶

Standard python version to use for managed venvs unless otherwise specified.

RIXAWebserver.settings.SECRET_KEYÂ¶

SECURITY WARNING: keep the secret key used in production secret!

RIXAWebserver.settings.SESSION_COOKIE_AGEÂ¶

Time in seconds before session is marked as invalid

RIXAWebserver.settings.SESSION_COOKIE_SAMESITEÂ¶

Make site work without SSL

RIXAWebserver.settings.SESSION_COOKIE_SECUREÂ¶

Make site work without SSL

RIXAWebserver.settings.SHOW_ALL_PLUGIN_EXCEPTIONSÂ¶

If set to false exceptions occuring in plugins will vanish. Otherwise they are formatted and logged on the debug level.

RIXAWebserver.settings.logfile_pathÂ¶

Where logfile is located. Without starting / it is considered relative to the working directory.
